summary: This is a declaration by a custodian of records certifying the authenticity of a FedEx invoice from December 2002 billed to Jeffrey Epstein. The document is a legal certification provided to law enforcement for use in the investigation and prosecution by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The FedEx invoice is billed to Jeffrey Epstein at his New York address, identifying him as the customer associated with the account.

events.title: FedEx Invoice Creation
events.description: A FedEx invoice (number 4-495-33932) was generated and billed to Jeffrey Epstein's account.

keyFacts: A FedEx invoice dated December 16, 2002, was billed to Jeffrey Epstein at 457 Madison Avenue, New York, NY.
The document is a custodian of records declaration certifying the authenticity of business records for use in a law enforcement investigation.
The records were provided to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in connection with the Epstein investigation and prosecution.
The declaration is made under penalty of perjury to establish the records as admissible evidence under Federal Rules of Evidence 902(11) and 803(6).
